website_summaries.verdict: A basic scraper that works well and comes with a reasonable price.
pros: Edge works well making snow and ice removal fast and effective
cons: At only 11 inches, it doesn't add much length to your reach

customer_reviews.title: Brass or plastic ice scraper will scratch windshield
customer_reviews.text: Used this ice scrapper on a brand new car and it left fine up and down scratches on windshield. In the past I have even used a ice scrapper with a brass blade called the Fantastic Ice Scaper with brass blade and it too left scratches but that was a different car. So I guess the lesson is to expect fine scratches from ice scrappers and to rarely use them unless you don't care about the scratches. Hence my okay three star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Trying2BeABetterPerson

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but tiring to hold
customer_reviews.text: The foam handle is nicely cushioned but the oval handle shape is too flat and wide for gripping without getting muscle fatigue. I'd like a round handle but the RevHeads brand isn't available. The low profile scoop will be good for getting underneath the windshield wipers, as well as fitting inside a door pocket. I use a medium grit nail file on the scraping edge to smooth any slight irregularities.
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: Works great for this ice
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in anticipation of the icy winters we get here in Seattle, and finally this week have put it to use. It’s excellent for thin ice but has some serious trouble on the thicker ice (just scrapes off the top layer). Not sure if that’s the scrapers fault, I’ve yet to find one that can handle thick ice like that.
customer_reviews.author: DPsupreme

customer_reviews.title: Item sent is not the same as picture
customer_reviews.text: The item received is not the same brand as the product sold. The item received doesn’t look like or have the same functions as the item being sold. This is a major disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: We are us

customer_reviews.title: No better than average
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased several different models of ice scrapers on the same day. None of them (including this one) worked any better than the ones I have purchased for a few bucks at the gas stations, supermarkets, etc. Save your money. Not worth the time & trouble to return it. I have left the same review on all my purchases for the day since they were all basically the same mediocrity.
customer_reviews.author: C M

customer_reviews.title: AWFUL, left scratches all over my windhsheild
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS CHEAP PEICE OF JUNK. Spend a little bit more and get a good scrapper. After one use, this product left my whole front windsheild all scratched up. Now I have to pay up to get my windhsield buffed to remove all the scratches. I'm VERY unhappy with this product and I can't believe they still are for sale. The plastic scrapper will get deformed during scraping and cause major scratches in the glass if you give it enough pressure. Buy at your own risk.
customer_reviews.author: Hrag

customer_reviews.title: Great ice scraper!
customer_reviews.text: This ice scraper is solid and large. The foam grip is nice and comfortable while providing friction in gloved hands. $8 is a little expensive for a piece of plastic, but it is something that I think I'll be able to use for a lifetime. I bought another for my wife, and we have both seen plenty of use out of them this winter. Overall, I highly recommend this product. I didn't find any flaws in them during my time using them. 5/5 stars. If you found this review helpful, please show some love by clicking the "Yes" button below. It really helps me to know what reviews you guys and gals like! Thanks for reading!
customer_reviews.author: Zero Ehxe

customer_reviews.title: Handy tool to have in your car when Mother Nature is in a nasty mood.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product. The scrapper end is substantial in size and for the most part cuts a nice clean path. The teeth on the opposite end do a decent job dislodging areas of chunked ice. I really like the rubberized oval shaped handle. It feels good in the hand and offers a secure grip. (This handle is quite robust and may be somewhat awkward in a smaller hand). Recently multiple layers of sleet, snow and freezing rain where dumped on us. As you can imagine, it took awhile to work through all that mess. But this scraper did a pretty good job. I like this product. I think you will too.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Davis

customer_reviews.title: Have bought 4
customer_reviews.text: The prices on these go up and down. I have caught 4 of them on sale and ordered one each time. All 4 have been blue. These are far superior to the ice scraper/crushers you buy at automotive stores or department stores. The grip is good and sturdy. I mostly use the scraper side. We live in the Southern Appalachians, lots of ice on the windshields in the mornings. I give each one a good once over, turned the wipers on and it clears it right off. I actually bought a bigger one, but have kept it on the porch to clean the porch steps off with. This Hopkins Subzero is all you need in a vehicle scraper.
customer_reviews.author: WWTop Contributor: Baseball

customer_reviews.title: Leaves scratches on your windshield
customer_reviews.text: I bought this ice scraper last winter and used it for one season... I've found it scratched up my windshield. This is the only ice scraper I've ever had leave scratches on my windshield. Not happy and would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Scraper
customer_reviews.text: Today was the first time i had a good layer of ice on my windshield to try this new scraper out on. It was horrible! I scraped and pushed so hard and it wouldn't get the ice off, not even a little. THe blunt edge of a butter knife would have probably been more useful. This wasn't even a super difficult layer of ice. No crystals, just a thin smooth layer. Also the area that the scraper would scrape was about a 1/2 in wide when the scraper is much larger than that. These are going back!
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Perfect ice scraper for a foot of snow
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this a few weeks ago in preparation for our trip to Mammoth, CA. On our last day, woke up to over a foot of fresh powder. After removing the bulk of the snow off of our vehicle, reached our windows which had accrued ice from the snow. This scraper fit the bill and the ice was easily removed. I’m not an ice expert (being from CA), but there were some areas on the windshield that required a little leverage to remove the ice. But, nothing that I felt was out of the ordinary. Great price and glad I had this with us on our trip as i feel I’ve already got my money’s worth out of it!
customer_reviews.author: Jay N.

customer_reviews.title: Hubby and son like them
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my husband and son to replace their old ones. Both men like them. However, both men also report that to reach the middle of their truck windows is nearly impossible with this....or any scraper....but this one tends to scratch them since the ice end gets stuck in their sleeves. They're learning how to use them, but "ergonomic" they are probably not....but what ice scraper is? Um...none of them. That said, the thickness of this plastic and the handle not rolling around in their hands more than makes up for it.
customer_reviews.author: MollieDuke

customer_reviews.title: Looks impressive but does not work
customer_reviews.text: Must be a lot of fake reviews for this item because it did not scrape the ice off my windshield at all. Doesn’t work on thin or thick ice.
customer_reviews.author: AML

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for light frosting
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for: small profile for light frosting on my sedan. I live in the Seattle area, so it doesn't full-on snow here like places in the East Coast or Midwest, but we do get a coating of frost when the temps occasionally drop to freezing or below in the fall/winter time. Easy to use and I like the foam grip for a comfy hold. I like that it's small and doesn't take up too much space for storing it in the car. This small size compliments my good car defroster, so the scraping work I have to do is minimal, actually.
customer_reviews.author: melody18

customer_reviews.title: High-quality with a nice wide edge!
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful scraper! It is made of heavy-duty plastic, and has a padded handle. It has a nice wide scraping head, making it quicker to use than other scrapers I've tried. It did not damage any of my windows, and it scraped the ice off smoothly and cleanly. The only recommendation I would have for improvement would be to make the product a little longer (I am 5'3", and I couldn't reach halfway across the windshield on my Mazda SUV). Overall, this is a high-quality product, and I recommend it. Please mark if you find my review helpful. Thank you so much!
customer_reviews.author: PeggyTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Best $5 I ever spent.
customer_reviews.text: Just used it this morning. Like some others have said, it scrapes through the ice on your window like a knife through butter. I already had an ice scraper/brush combo that was mildly effective but this thing just blows it out of the water. It normally takes like 15 minutes to scrape the ice off my car because I would have to wait until the engine warmed up to start scraping (otherwise it was really difficult, almost impossible) but today I was able to scrape all the ice off my windshield and windows in less than 5 minutes. I would definitely recommend this tool to anyone that lives in colder areas because the price/performance ratio is on point.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Nice ice scraper
customer_reviews.text: I live in the deep South sirarely does it get cold enough to require one of these. But when it does I am normally unprepared :(. I purchased this to have for those rare mornings. It does nice to scrap the frost off when you fail to warm your car up first. Haven't used it for any tough ice jobs yet but I'm sure it can handle it. I'm updating my review because we had our first real ice and it took forever to get it off my window with this.
customer_reviews.author: Sissy

customer_reviews.title: Makes ice disappear like melted butter.
customer_reviews.text: I helped a neighbor scrape her car windows using this and she asked me to order one for her. She has to use a walker and it was difficult for her to keep her balance while cleaning ice off her car with her old scraper at the end of a snow brush. She fell while doing so until she got this one. Needs less pressure so it's faster and easier. She loves it! I love it!
customer_reviews.author: RettaKay

customer_reviews.title: Received a random, incorrect scraper
customer_reviews.text: Took over a week to get here (even though it's Prime) and I received a scraper that doesn't even remotely resemble the one in the picture. No foam grip. Thin shape and different scraper head. Totally random brand and absolutely not what I ordered. WTF?
customer_reviews.author: Remy Novak

customer_reviews.title: Only took 7 hours.
customer_reviews.text: The neighborhood kids are what you might call pranksters. While I'm 85 I can still relate. However, they got me pretty good this winter. I park my car in the street and don't get out much, which gave these knuckle heads plenty of time to give my 1985 Cutlass Cierra daily hosings. This resulted in most valuable car in my collection being shrouded in a dam near foot thick on ice.....so I get on the old interwebs to address this nightmare and find this little number. Took 7 hours, but it got the job done. I'm got one for my son too.
customer_reviews.author: Earl O'Brien

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Quality, windshield scraper
customer_reviews.text: Very Nice Quality, windshield scraper. I use this mostly when there's ice of course...and when what's melted re-freezes. Like under the wiper blades. The length short enough, I can get some real elbow grease behind it, (for a not so strong woman)... and I don't have to keep scraping & scraping, until I'm exhausted. I would purchase this again, without hesitation !!
customer_reviews.author: L. D. Drake

customer_reviews.title: CA and it just so happened to be at the same time as one of the worst winter storms in many years
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in preparation for our trip to Lake Arrowhead, CA and it just so happened to be at the same time as one of the worst winter storms in many years. Since I had the only ice scraper, I had to remove the ice from 3 cars total. I could see the plastic wearing off after the third car, but it's not a big deal. And yes, I used the other end for the ice, then the flat end for frost. I found this most useful I got another, and kept it stored in our winter gear.
customer_reviews.author: MBeige

customer_reviews.title: Head Sheared Off From Handle
customer_reviews.text: Had ice on the car this morning. While using the device the head sheared off from the handle. Tried Super Glue, but the device was basically worthless
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not sure why everyone loves it
customer_reviews.text: I live in upstate NY. I have a long snow brush with a scraper on the end. That scraper has tiny gaps in it so when I use it, it leaves frost and ice no matter how hard I scrape. So I got this one. It's got great reviews. It's the same as any old scraper. The size and shape doesn't help it to get good leverage. The straight side doesn't do any better than what I had. So all in all for the price I'm pretty disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied customer
customer_reviews.text: As described, a work horse that doesn't need a "special" nylon carry case or microfiber cloth. Bought an "executive" model first, then when I used it, I bought this. I use this. It scrapes ice, a lot of ice, off your windshield. That's it's job, and it does it's job well. True, Apple won't ever sell this in it's store, but why do we really buy an ice scraper; for form or for function? Buy this, it scrapes ice off your windshield. It doesn't complain.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: Sadly, I've had to use this scraper several times already. The good news, it's an excellent scraper. It's a nice size, easy to grip. It's strongly constructed and does a great job getting the ice off the windows. I love the strong little hard core scraper on the back to break up ice when it's thick. Overall, nice piece and worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Grant Fritchey

customer_reviews.title: Light but Very Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This scraper was very easy to use and it cut through the ice on my window like a champ! The handle is cushioned and feels comfortable in my hand. I was worried this scraper wouldn't hold up bu not only is it comfortable to use but it almost seems like it was made for the curves of my window. It gets all the ice smoothly and cleanly.
customer_reviews.author: Rita Karaffa

customer_reviews.title: Good ice scrape
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing special about this Subzero ice scraper, but when the ice is really caked on the car windows, it does a good job. A couple times, on the worst days, the other end is helpful to chunk up the ice before flipping it back around to scrape it away. It doesn't feel super sturdy, but I have used it many times, and it is holding up so far. For the price, I'm happy getting one good season out of it.
customer_reviews.author: C. Boudreau

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used this, we had a random snow storm in November (usually doesn't snow until Jan, if at all, here). The first day it took the frost off the windshield easily. The next day it had snowed and then had freezing rain right after, so there was a thick layer of solid snow on the car. Took a little bit of work, but the scraper took it all off without scratching the windshield or top of the car.

customer_reviews.title: Frost & Ice Crusher
customer_reviews.text: This ice crusher is wonderful. I dread cleaning the car off much less now that I own this beauty. It makes cleaning the ice off my windshield is easy. Frost. That was the real reason I purchased this. And it lived up to my expectations. I no longer have to curse when I walk outside and see an impossibility thin layer of frost on my windshield. I have now dubbed this thing my Frost & Ice Crusher.

customer_reviews.title: It works well!
customer_reviews.text: I've used this a couple of times now, and I'm glad I purchased it! It's a basic ice scraper and does its job. The ice I've had to scrape has not been very thick at all, so I'm not sure how it would do in the colder climates (I'm in Northern California where it only occasionally gets to freezing). The handle fits well and is easy to use...
customer_reviews.author: A. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Tempted to give it 0 stars for running on witchcraft
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty sure there's some black magic involved in making this thing work so well. This is the best ice scraper I have ever used by a wide margin. The first time I used it, I was absolutely shocked by the ease with which it cleared through the layer of ice and how clean the path it left behind was. Now I just wish they made a giant version of this that worked as well on driveways.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Griffith

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This works great and is a good size that it fits in the glovebox of my truck. Very comfortable and squishy grip. I think I will buy their other one with the brush too as well so I can clear snow off my car in areas other than the windshield and windows. Nice product!
customer_reviews.author: C. Blake

customer_reviews.title: Awesome. Dependable.
customer_reviews.text: Had used it for normal light winter weather in east Idaho. Recently I went down to Oklahoma and gotnhit by a massive ice winter storm which left a 1/4 inch of iach on everything. This scraper was awesome. I tried another scraper I had butbitnjuatxcoulsnt get through the solid ice on my car. This Hopkins had no problem. I was super impressed and thankful. The ice destroyer is awesome and the window frost scraper works great too, love the extra wide model. Only downside is it's designed in a way that when using the wide frost scrapper , if u gocto fast it will spray the shavings straight into your face lol.
customer_reviews.author: MUNCUS

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, good compact option
customer_reviews.text: Have used it throughout several years with several winter seasons. It's a good dedicated and compact ice scraper tool that doesn't take up much space in your car. Comfortable to hold and use, shows no sign of wearing down badly or breaking. Great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: So right off the bat, I need to admit that I'm using this scraper in Texas and the amount of ice I'm using it on would probably be laughed at by anybody from the north. Now that that's out of the way, I can safely say that this scraper works perfectly. It's small enough to fit in my glove box, very sturdy, and sharp enough to scrape ice with ease. I ended up ordering 2 of these, one for my truck and one for my wife's car.
customer_reviews.author: J. Blackwell

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and helpful!
customer_reviews.text: I was rather taken by surprise when our first snowstorm of the season hit, looking for something to clean the snow and ice off of my car windows. This scraper takes care of both, is easy to keep in the car and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Louise

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, soft grip
customer_reviews.text: Have only used this twice on ice/frost, but as someone used to very mild winters, this is simple and effective and comfortable to use. It is super lightweight and has a soft, deep grip that I'd imagine would be welcome for those with carpal tunnel, etc. Haven't needed to use the ice breaker side yet, but the scraper side works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Lance&Anne RobinsonTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Plush flat against the glass works very well
customer_reviews.text: Finally was able to use the other day and it worked great. The thickness of ice is irrelevant with this. Sometimes when the ice is thin you can barely get the ice off without multiple strokes. This is perfectly flat so even with a thin layer of ice it takes only one swipe to clear.
customer_reviews.author: Murahari Dynasty

customer_reviews.title: Where has this been all my life?
customer_reviews.text: For years I have put up with ice scrapers that quit on me early on and then I deal with tiny scraped lines causing much longer windshield clean-off time. This ice scraper does not mess around and scrapes cleanly and quickly! The only thing I wish is that it had a slightly longer handle. Being a short girl, I have to lean on my car a bit if I want to hit the middle of my windshield (I have a crossover). That's a minor problem considering how well it handles ice!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Nothing special
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews I was hopeful this would give a wider scrape than the typical and disappointing 1-2 inches I've gotten from other windshield ice scrapers, but no, at least not on my car (2012 Subaru Forester).
customer_reviews.author: Alex Gossett

customer_reviews.title: I have been looking for a good sturdy well designed ice scraper for ages
customer_reviews.text: Finally, someone using their noggin before they throw something out to the public. I have been looking for a good sturdy well designed ice scraper for ages, just never happened, till now. This ice scraper has a nice edge on it for scraping even the toughest ice. It's very comfortable to use with the nice soft grip and is just long enough to reach halfway across the windshield. You should buy this, it works very good. I only gave it 4 stars because 5 stars are meant for angels and gods.
customer_reviews.author: mike reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Great way to win battle with your freezer!
customer_reviews.text: After breaking 3 or 4 cheap plastic scrapers in my 'chest' freezer I saw a questions answered for this with an enthusiastic review for a freezer. They were right. it gets a wider swath and is VERY unlikely to break. If you've got a "hanging" basket in your freezer, this keeps it moveable.
customer_reviews.author: Lovin' the River

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: Made of cheap and light weight hard plastic. Broke apart after a few uses.
customer_reviews.author: Psaro

customer_reviews.title: Great scraper
customer_reviews.text: Living in Minnesota you need a good snow bruch and a good scraper. Because of remodeling at our home we had to park the cars outside. So we good numerous days of ice on the windows. This scraper worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Woodshop Man

customer_reviews.title: Great Ice Scraper!
customer_reviews.text: We've had some pretty harsh frost, snow, and ice in Winter 2017, and this ice scraper has taken it like a champ. The handle is comfortable, and both the scraper and crusher edges have proven to be exceptionally durable.
customer_reviews.author: LoneWolffe

customer_reviews.title: Sufficient
customer_reviews.text: Works well enough. The flat end is not the perfect scraper as described -- it does still scrape in lines to some extent if you're scraping just frost -- but heavy ice is easily dislodged.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great small scraper to keep in the car
customer_reviews.text: Living in New England, you never know when you might need a snow scraper in the car for an icy windshield or back window. This scraper is sturdy and strong, with a nicely padded handle grip. It is small enough to stow in the car but still has a large enough scraper blade to make quick work of an icy windshield.
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey Kleinman

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, fast, and effective.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this ice scraper for several months, but I live in a warmer climate and haven't needed it until recently. It works very well for scraping frost off of my car in the morning, and it clears a lot amount of ice/frost quickly. The scraper also worked wonderfully for getting ~2 inches of accumulated snow and ice off of my car. The scraper itself is large (nearly 12 inches from one end to the other), easy to hold/handle, and has a nice soft grip. It's easy to use and well priced.
customer_reviews.author: Kari

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't scrape too well
customer_reviews.text: This sadly did not do as well as I'd hoped for scraping ice. I often end up with ice on the inside of my car from a poorly installed windshield that lets in extra moisture so I wanted a shorter handled scraper for getting rid of frost on the inside of my car windows. Grrr. But it didn't scrape all that well. A hard piece of plastic like an old credit card did a better job. It did arrive on time and the ice chipped may work better but I put it to rest after it didn't do the trick. I will keep looking for a better tool.
customer_reviews.author: PrepGal14526

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to put into my daughters car. Here in Texas we don't need one often but it keeps my daughter from taking mine out of my truck and not replacing it.
customer_reviews.author: happy online shopper

customer_reviews.title: Better than advertised
customer_reviews.text: Here's the deal - it fits in your glovebox or map pocket and is way more durable than any of the lightweight plastic ones you'll find in the big box store. I waited until we got our blizzard to review this item and what a wonderful little ice scraper it is. It's more durable, thicker, and stronger than it looks in the photo. If I ever manage to break it I will buy more. I think this would make a fantastic winter travel gift for friends or relatives.
customer_reviews.author: Vitreous

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy with good coverage; clear snow with dustpan first
customer_reviews.text: This is a beefy scraper--wide enough for good coverage, but not so wide that warping decreases contact with the windshield. To clear frost under a layer of snow, use a plastic dustpan to scoop off snow while your car heater kicks in. Then this scraper can really perform.
customer_reviews.author: MargaretNC

customer_reviews.title: good product for the price
customer_reviews.text: You have to go over the windows a few times to get it really clear but it's a decent product for the price. I just have to use my windshield wipers after I finished to get all the leftover ice pieces off
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: It cuts through the toughest ice and scrapes it away.
customer_reviews.text: I love this ice scraper. I bought one for every member of my family. it is easy to grip and breaks the ice up then scrapes it away. it is incredibly durable. The best ever.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Haven't had to use really...
customer_reviews.text: As I have a remote starter for my car usually it defrosts everything, but I have them just in case Indiana gets that hellacious snow storm one day. It will be nice to have.
customer_reviews.author: David Ray

customer_reviews.title: It’s worth buying.
customer_reviews.text: Works great on frost and snow. Haven’t tried it on ice yet but I’m certain it will do fine. I threw away my other scrapers because this one works so well.
customer_reviews.author: TARA CARLIN

customer_reviews.title: Small. Very small
customer_reviews.text: Great product. But as a 5’5” person, it’s much too short to get the whole windshield on my Buick Enclave. Ultimately, I’m giving it to my husband to use with his car.
customer_reviews.author: TJLucy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Best ice scraper I’ve used. I live in Maine and have to scrape my car many many times. This one is great, you won’t regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Stofflet

customer_reviews.title: Rock star winter savior!
customer_reviews.text: This thing totally rocks. The serrated end breaks the thick ice and then the thin end finishes the job in no time. The thin end is super-hard and holds up well over months, even with thick ice. At this price point you could replace it yearly if you needed to, but unless you're in Boston you probably won't have to. I grew up in Philly and have wintered in Colorado, Alaska and the high-desert in NM (nightly thick frost) and this is hands-down the best product I've ever used. After 1 week I bought 2 more - one for my wife and a back-up for me. Forget those long things with their stupid brushes and just buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Macbride

customer_reviews.title: Got dull after 2 or 3 uses and couldn't get frost off anymore.
customer_reviews.text: It worked great to scrape frost the first two or three times I used it, then the plastic got full and stopped getting even half the frost per pass. It's junk.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Biggly Ice BRUTE
customer_reviews.text: Biggly ice brute! Bought as a gag for someone that scheduled on working a year+ long project in Ohio coming from Houston Texas. Memories of upstate NY living make me wish I'd had this back then. Bigger than I expected and a nice cushion handle. I guess he'll let me know how well it works in the fall. BRRR!
customer_reviews.author: Fixerupper

customer_reviews.title: Better than the wxpensive brands
customer_reviews.text: Ive had this for a few weeks now and i just decided to add a review. Its a good quality and an easy grip. I m finish within 5 min of doing my windshield
customer_reviews.author: diamondiva

customer_reviews.title: Decent scraper, but not as heavy-duty as I'd hoped
customer_reviews.text: I had expected this scraper to have a little bit more heft to it than it actually does - it's very lightweight plastic and felt almost flimsy when I first took it out of the box. I live in the southeast, so I don't exactly need something to shovel mountains of snow off my car in the morning... based on how lightweight this thing is, I'd assume you'd want/need something a little more heavy duty for that job. So far, though, it's worked well to scrape light ice and overnight frost off my car windows in the morning.
customer_reviews.author: L. Howell

customer_reviews.title: It cuts through the ice better, I don't have to use near the effort
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a different reason than most people. I work with sub freezers that we cannot defrost, but they must be scraped at least once a week. The amount of ice can be anywhere from a half inch thick to an inch thick. This thing cuts right through it. My hands usually hurt from scraping, with the old scraper, but not this one. It cuts through the ice better, I don't have to use near the effort. I will probably buy another one!
customer_reviews.author: Alora67

customer_reviews.title: A very good, tough tool !!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very tough little scraper ! I have even used it to open other Amazon packages and no sign of any damage whatsoever! My wife holds onto it as a self defense tool at times! Will always get one for each of my vehicles
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Recommended product that is recommended
customer_reviews.text: Recommended by Wirecutter, and lives up to the hype. Sturdy, aggressive, good handle even if it is cold or wet. No downsides found yet.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Adkins

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy won’t break
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty scraper. Works well for ice and frost and snow. Very easy to handle. Short shaft so you have to reach if you have big windows.
customer_reviews.author: JA Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Descent!
customer_reviews.text: Works good for normal frost and snow but when you have the thick ice its not the best or most powerfull. You need more leverage of something that is on a 2 foot pole style.
customer_reviews.author: Blaine Tessmann

customer_reviews.title: An ice scraper, for heaven's sake...only matters when you really need one
customer_reviews.text: Living in the foothills of the Blue Ridge, not too long ago we had some serious winter weather. But climate change, global warning, the NSA or just random weather patterns, what ever you choose to attribute it to, it has been four or five years since we had a real winter. This year has been different. Early snows, deep freezes, and a house full of drivers, we couldn't find a scraper between any of us. Ordered a half dozen of these and it is a definite keeper. One end is a claw that scribes ice, the other a robust scraper that does the job. Highly recommended and built for real world use, this will be hard to break.
customer_reviews.author: T.L.B.

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty ice scraper
customer_reviews.text: Nowhere in the Houston, Texas area so they stock ice scrapers. Growing up in the Northeast I always carried at least three in my car. This one arrived two days before our first frost. Worked great, very heavy duty and crushes the ice on the windshield very cleanly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid ice beaker
customer_reviews.text: This is a good ice scraper, pretty solid. I prefer this over a longer one because long ice scrapers can be bulky and awkward to hold while applying great force to scrape away ice.
customer_reviews.author: zombiecrisis7

customer_reviews.title: Handy, Practical Tool
customer_reviews.text: This came better than expected. It's got a cushiony grip area so that's quite nice, and it seems pretty sturdy and durable, so I guess we'll be using these for years and years to come. It is expensive though, even for a very nice one.
customer_reviews.author: Va Belle

customer_reviews.title: Good size for packing in your bag at work
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy construction and well sized for window scraping. This doesn't replace my telescoping scraper but, for its size, its easy to toss in the bag and keep with me at work. I use this to dig out the car enough to access my large scraper and complete the work. I like that the handle is large enough for an adult hand and grippy enough that with gloves it won't go flying when I put force into cutting through Pennsylvania ice.
customer_reviews.author: OlympusRan

customer_reviews.title: You’re here looking, get it already!
customer_reviews.text: This little guy is a BEAST! Toss it in my truck, toss it in my glove box, it doesn’t matter where I toss it, this thing is always ready for some winter action. Buy this now if you’re looking for a small, sturdy, reliable ice scraper!
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence D.

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you get what you order!
customer_reviews.text: Bought one and it was as advertised - works just fine. Ordered a second and received one that was completely different - no padded handle, no smaller ice breaker on the other end. Just an ice scraper so I didn't bother to return it but beware of what you receive.
customer_reviews.author: NightTrain39

customer_reviews.title: Good for ice
customer_reviews.text: It is not cumbersome and gets ice off very well. I have it 4 stars because it is too small and doesn’t allow me to reach across my windshield like another product I own
customer_reviews.author: B. Irving

customer_reviews.title: Solid choice. Not great if the ice is SUPER thick though.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, handle is a little on short side but you get what you pay for. If you are scraping thick ice it will be VERY loud so expect it.
customer_reviews.author: Cormag

customer_reviews.title: When you only want to buy one and be done
customer_reviews.text: Why is this tool so hard to create? This product finally gives me the reassurance I needed from other scrapers. Other scrapers seem to just snap after a single season. Already used this one a handful of times and feel it'll last for a while!
customer_reviews.author: AdaptiveArtist

customer_reviews.title: Great scraper
customer_reviews.text: I replace my scrapers each year, as the edge dulls and is harder to use. I like the simplicity of this scraper, which gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Jim59

customer_reviews.title: Super Efficient
customer_reviews.text: This is a sturdy little scraper that means business. I like that it will last for years to come. I keep it in the back for emergencies. It does a superior job of getting close to the car surface without scratching. We have serious frost/snow in the Tennessee mountains and this did a great job on my car. I got caught in snow while out shopping. I simply pulled out this scraper and cleaned my windows back/front and drove home. Fast, easy and it gets super close for a clean finish. I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: C. Acosta

customer_reviews.title: My credit card works better
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. Does not scrape ice off my windshield, my credit card works better.
customer_reviews.author: Jordy Linkins

customer_reviews.title: this is perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Awesomely inexpensive ice crusher and scraper. Performed well in the early snow season with simple snow scrapes and crushing ice on windshields and lights. Although it's a cheap price, that's what you get in sturdiness. I accidentally closed the door on one of the heads a bit and it just snapped right off but is still useable without the handle. If you're looking for a small and cheap ice scraper, this is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: A satisfied customer

customer_reviews.title: Pathetic
customer_reviews.text: I will make this easy: This performed more poorly than my existing, two year-old, worn-out scraper. Wouldn't even consider this one again.
customer_reviews.author: L. Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Nice Blade, Seems Short
customer_reviews.text: This scraper has a nice blade on it that does a good job of assisting in ice removal from car windows and the like. The entire blade did make contact with the window evenly, however it is a bit shorter than I expected, which is probably my fault. I just assumed this was an "average" length scraper. I can't reach the middle of the windshield with this scraper. I'm 5'6" with an average reach. The grip is a bit spongy and feels nice in the hand.
customer_reviews.author: E.K.

customer_reviews.title: This is a fantastic ice scraper
customer_reviews.text: You won't go wrong for a small portable ice scraper it rocks. The claw side for tough ice and the scraper side to get the rest off
customer_reviews.author: Steven Serrano

customer_reviews.title: FAST!!!
customer_reviews.text: This scraper covers a wide area. I don't know what's different but it conforms to the curve of the window somehow better than others.
customer_reviews.author: Bull Moose

customer_reviews.title: it gets cool enough in Alabama to where ice forms on the ...
customer_reviews.text: Every so often, it gets cool enough in Alabama to where ice forms on the windshield. I found this little tool is pretty effective at clearing the windows so I can see. On any given day where I'd need to use this, I can clear enough ice to safely see in maybe 30-60 seconds. I then use the defroster in the car and can usually melt the rest of the ice after 5-10 mins on the road to give a full field of vision.
customer_reviews.author: Cheese

customer_reviews.title: The wide scraper is awesome and the size is small enough to not take ...
customer_reviews.text: I have needed a scraper all winter for the occasional frost we get in the south. This scraper works exactly as advertised. I'm usually running late, so I wanted a scraper that cleared away frost on the first swipe and not one that I have to scrape the same spot several times. The wide scraper is awesome and the size is small enough to not take over my backseat. I can easily hide it under my seat when I'm not using it. Definitely worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Online shopper

customer_reviews.title: Gift to young lady
customer_reviews.text: Not much use in Florida but after a 5:00 wake-up call because of frost on windshield I had to give as a gag gift for the next time the attack of the frost monster!
customer_reviews.author: Tony Holladay

customer_reviews.title: Best freezer scraper i have had
customer_reviews.text: We have a freezer that is in constant use and gets frost easily. This really scrapes it off easily
customer_reviews.author: Dianne K.

customer_reviews.title: Good Bye Frost.
customer_reviews.text: As someone who lives in California, I don't get much snow but I get this for when I have to get to my car super early in the morning with that thick layer of frost. I am glad to say that it slides right through like a hot knife on butter. It is a little big but I expect it was built for someone who was wearing gloves trying to get that thick layer of snow off. Either way it fits nicely in my glove compartment for easy storage.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey Ngo

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Already starting to loose it's edge after a month. Obviously if you have a big windshield it will not be ergonomic for that purpose. But it's better than not having one.
customer_reviews.author: Trim

customer_reviews.title: Scratches On Windshield/Windows
customer_reviews.text: I have never had a scraper that scratched my car windows, so unfortunately it never occurred to me to worry about this one until the scratching was done. I wish I could go back in time and stick with my short-handled, non-scratching scraper.
customer_reviews.author: Shoppergirl

customer_reviews.title: Great ice scraper
customer_reviews.text: Great ice scraper. Just the right angle to scrape ice off quickly and efficiently. The grip is comfortable. It’s a nice, compact size. I have at least 2 of these.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah McClary

customer_reviews.title: Well made and hold up great
customer_reviews.text: Ise and snow on your vehicle windows are no match for this tool. Easy to hold, and and strong enough to scrape of heavy layers of ice and snow.
customer_reviews.author: Rev. Ronald C. Moss

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: this scraper is easy to use scrapes off the frost with ease and foam grip handle is very nice to hold without slipping
customer_reviews.author: eric

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this. He said it works great and was exactly what he was looking for. I thought the price was fantastic! Everyone is happy!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Leigh

customer_reviews.title: Good buy!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for a "quick scrape," and it works as you would expect. Very sturdy, but for most may be too short to be your primary window scraper, but as a backup...it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

product_meta.title: Hopkins Subzero 16621 Ice Crusher Ice Scraper (Colors May Vary)
product_meta.description: The SubZero 11" Ice Crusher Scraper features strong scarper blades, ice chipper and a foam cushioned grip for handling. The scraper is equipped with a blade that clears frost instantly on one end and a separate ice chipper on the other end that improves ice removal capability. The oval shaped foam grip also provides maximum comfort for handling. For over forty years Hopkins Manufacturing and SubZero have shaped the winter snow and ice tools category.
feature_bullets: Separated ice chippers to break up the thickest ice
Oval shaped, soft foam grip provides maximum comfort
Features an 11" length that provides great reach
